definition[0]: not wanting to do something and refusing to do it
example[0]: He was unwilling or unable to pay the fine.
definition[1]: not wanting to do something but doing it
example[2]: She's unwilling to admit that she was wrong.
example[3]: Stuart was an unwilling participant in the shooting.
example[4]: Put  away any toys the child is not willing to share, to avoid any problems.
definition[2]: not willing to do something, although you may be persuaded after a while. Also used when someone does something after at first being unwilling to do it
example[5]: He was reluctant to talk about his childhood.
example[7]: the government's reluctant agreement to hold talks
definition[3]: given unwillingly – used about admiration, respect, support, or an apology
example[9]: He gave her a grudging apology.
example[10]: He could not help feeling a grudging admiration for the old lady.
definition[4]: to not want to do something, especially something that you might have to do – a rather formal use
example[11]: He has more staff than he needs, but he is loath to get rid of good people.
